column4: if i want to scan my windows partition for viruses from ubuntu what should I use?
you can use clamav
none, it's in the repo although the clamav ppa has newer stuffs
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:ubuntu-clamav/ppa; sudo apt-get -y install clamav; sudo freshclam
i suggest uninstalling openoffice and any old unused kernels you may have, frees up lots of space. Also run: sudo apt-get clean   can help
sudo apt-get --purge remove openoffice*
dpkg -l | less    will show all installed packages
READ the command I gave, not what you think it says
the asterisk was not an accident
the command i gave with the ppa will give a newer lot
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:ubuntu-clamav/ppa; sudo apt-get -y install clamav; sudo freshclam
yes all as one
as you already have it installed you just need: sudo apt-get upgrade; sudo freshclam
then let it finish
possibly
exactly
if you run:  smbtree   do you see the shares?
I see it, how do I browse it?
press ALT+F2 and type:   smb://server/share    replace server with the server name, replace share with the share name
why are you using samba4?
it's not showing me the tree anymore
then restart the smbd service. I suggest you use samba and not samba4
smb://LAPTOP/Downloads isn't doing anything
